page.title: 18Tourists at Kylesku.
page.content: Two of our regular visitors come up to Kylesku 10 to 15 times a year. They come because of the mountains and sea, the fishing, sailing, walking in wild places and the friendly people. Their holiday home, built in 1805, was the school at one time. It has an outside toilet, no central heating and no electricity. They enjoy "getting away from their busy life style in Pitlochry". Many people visit our area during the holiday season. Some tourists only pass through because there is a bridge now, but others stay a while. Most of the tourists I questioned said the beautiful scenery and the peacefulness were the main attractions. Last year a new chalet park was opened, giving more accommodation to those wishing to visit the North West.
